title: What are the latest business news of August 16, 2020? - Quora

response.answer_text: Business news #9 - August 16, 2020 1) Mukesh Ambani on August 15 said that “COVID-19 is the most disruptive event in modern history”.  2) China’s Bytedance is in early discussions with Mukesh Ambani’s Reliance Industries for an investment of TikTok’s India, according to reports.  3) TikTok and its US employees are planning to take President Donald Trump's administration to court over his sweeping order to ban the popular video app.  A lawyer preparing one of the lawsuits against Donald Trump.4) Investment bank Barclays has said that India's GDP may shrink 6% in 2020–2021 amid COVID-19 situations.  Barclays expects the countries GDP to shrink by 25.5% in the April-June quarter and followed by an 8% shrink in the July-September quarter.5) State-owned oil refiner Bharat Petroleum has decided to cut its capital expenditure.  Bharat Petroleum has decided to cut its capital expenditure target by 36% for 2020–2021 to around INR8000 crore from INR12000 crore due to the pandemic situation.6) Eicher Motors Group company has acquired Volvo Bus India for Rs 100.5 crore.  7) Commerce minister Piyush Goyal has said that “India will take equal and proportional measures to protest domestic manufacturing”.
